text: My favorite alcoholic beverage. Very fun but simple. Easy to drink, as if mineral water was alcoholic. I wish I could find it in stores so I could stock my fridge with it. Not overly sweet at all but not overly "saké" either. Perfect for saké beginners such as myself. I find I like some saké better than wine so wish there was a bigger market for this kind of saké.

Bottled sampled at winefest. Not as much carbonation as a sparkling wine, but enough you know it is there on the palate. Light and airy, some mild fruit notes. Lower alcohol is fine, clear, and a little sweet mid taste but dries out near the end.
Bottle at Craigs. Pours like a glass of cava. Aromas of pineapple. Taste is oily, sweet.
Bottle. Near clear with white head. Aroma of sparkling wine, earth, apple. Taste is a bit rank, super earthy, coconut water, alcohol, cheap wine. Long unpleasant finish
bottle at home ... light yellow ... thin white lacing ... soft dry coconut nose ... soft fruit .. dry rice ... soft coconut ... light alcohol ... light dry pineapple
Bottle at Craigs. Pours incredibly pale clear golden, nose is pineapple, fruity, taste is earthy, light pineapple, sweet.
bottle - This sake has a pale, nearly clear color with an aroma of rice and light fruit. It honestly tastes rather like a lightly sweet hard apple cider. Its bubbly, light and refreshing.
Just really not a huge sake fan when Im not in Japan. This one is pretty refreshing but still has a flavor like rubbing alcohol.

Bottle 
Pours like water , but with gas and a small foam 
Smells like typical sake 
Taste is dry , cava- inspired , yet typical sake . Nice
Bottle share. Very champagne like. Dry and low sweetness. Alcohol burn is light but there
Clear, sweet and sparkling. Good served cold. Will not pull me away from most beers.
